body.p:
Hawesville Ky Sep 21st 1861
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin governor of the State of Kentucky and commander in chief of the state forces

Having received in June orders No 4, and the company styled Hancock Rifles of which I am Second Lieutenant, having refused to take the oath required by said orders and imposed by the 2nd section of an act to amend an act for the better organization of the militia and that company being thereby disbanded I beg leave to tender my resignation as second Lieutenant in the State Guard having the honor to be

Your excellensys obedient servant
J. A. Mundy

Recommeded to be accepted
By Order
Genl T. L. Crittenden
by Geo. W. Monroe
A. D. Camp
accepted
B. Magoffin
